text: Everyone's hacking their $20 Claude subscription to run agents. I just pay for the API. My agents have run 24/7 for months, zero bans, zero drama. Sometimes the 'expensive' route is the cheap one.

Figma just shipped an MCP that turns Claude Code UI into editable Figma frames. I spent 15 years as an art director before I started building AI systems. This is the first tool that actually sits at the intersection of both.

OpenClaw's creator got hired by OpenAI. Everyone's debating the implications. I woke up to 5 Skool posts written, a LinkedIn post queued, and trend research done, all before 7am. Debates are interesting. Systems are better.
Everyone's building n8n workflows to replace their $1,500/mo VA. I built mine to replace myself. Research, writing, posting, image gen, publishing, all automated. The VA was never the bottleneck.
